description: Master BDD to bridge the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders using human-readable specifications

slides.title: What is BDD?
slides.content:
# Behavior Driven Development ü§ù

An extension of TDD that focuses on the **behavior** of the system from the perspective of the business and the user.

- **Collaboration**: Designers, Developers, and QA work together.
- **Language**: Uses natural language (Ubiquitous Language).

slides.title: BDD Purpose
slides.content:
# Why BDD? üí°

- **Alignment**: Ensures everyone agrees on *what* we are building before we build it.
- **Living Documentation**: The tests are readable by non-technical people.
- **Reduced Waste**: Prevents building features that don't match business requirements.

slides.title: Gherkin Syntax
slides.content:
# Given-When-Then ü•í

Scenarios are written in **Gherkin**, a structured natural language.

- **Given**: The initial context (Setup).
- **When**: An action occurs (Event).
- **Then**: The expected outcome (Assertion).

slides.title: A Gherkin Example
slides.content:
# Formal Specs üìÑ

```gherkin
Feature: User Login

  Scenario: Successful login with valid credentials
    Given I am on the login page
    When I enter "shameel" and "pass123"
    And I click the login button
    Then I should see my dashboard
```

slides.title: The Three Amigos
slides.content:
# Collaboration üë•

BDD thrives on the "Three Amigos" meeting:
1. **Product Owner**: Defines the 'What'.
2. **Developer**: Explains the 'How'.
3. **Tester**: Finds the edge cases and 'What if?' scenarios.

slides.title: Step Definitions
BDD Tooling
slides.content:
# Popular Tools üõ†Ô∏è

- **Cucumber**: The most famous BDD tool (Java, JS, Ruby).
- **SpecFlow**: BDD for .NET.
- **Behat**: BDD for PHP.
- **Cypress-Cucumber-Preprocessor**: Integrates Gherkin into Cypress.

slides.title: User Stories
slides.content:
# Requirements üìù

BDD scenarios often stem from **User Stories**:

> "As a [User Role], I want [Feature], so that [Value]."

slides.title: Collaboration Quiz
slides.content: The dream team.

slides.title: Scenario Outlines
slides.content:
# Dynamic Data üìä

```gherkin
Scenario Outline: Different login attempts
  When I enter "<user>" and "<pass>"
  Then I should see "<message>"

  Examples:
    | user   | pass    | message |
    | bob    | 123     | Error   |
    | alice  | secret  | Welcome |
```

slides.title: Ubiquitous Language
slides.content:
# Common Tongue üó£Ô∏è

BDD encourages using the same terms in the UI, the code, and the database as the business stakeholders use (e.g., "Policy", "Claim", "Premium").

slides.title: BDD vs TDD
slides.content:
# Differences ‚öñÔ∏è

- **TDD**: Developer-focused, tests implementation/modules.
- **BDD**: Business-focused, tests system behavior/scenarios.

> [!TIP]
> Use BDD for high-level features and TDD for low-level logic!

slides.title: Backgrounds
slides.content:
# Setting the Stage üé¨

Use `Background` in Gherkin to define steps that run before **every** scenario in a feature file (like a `beforeEach` hook).

They replace the need for step definitions
slides.title: Features Quiz
slides.content: Reusability.

slides.title: Tags & Organization
slides.content:
# Filtering üè∑Ô∏è

Use tags like `@smoke`, `@regression`, or `@slow` to group scenarios and decide which ones to run in different CI/CD stages.

slides.title: Living Documentation
slides.content:
# Always Up-to-Date üìö

Since the documentation (Gherkin) **IS** the test, it can never become obsolete. If the behavior changes, the tests break, forcing a documentation update.

slides.title: Handling Failure
slides.content:
# Clear Why ‚ùå

When a BDD test fails, the error is descriptive: "Expected to see 'Welcome' but saw 'Error'". This is much easier for a PO to understand than a generic stack trace.

slides.title: Challenges with BDD
slides.content:
# Pitfalls üßó

- **Verbose**: Gherkin can become hard to manage if scenarios are too long.
- **Overhead**: Writing step definitions takes extra time.
- **Brittle**: If the UI changes frequently, Gherkin specs might need constant updates.

slides.quizQuestion: True or False: BDD intended to completely replace Unit Testing.
slides.title: Final Quiz
slides.content: Scope check.

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Summary üéâ

- ‚úÖ Focus on **Behavior** and **User Value**.
- ‚úÖ Use **Gherkin** (Given-When-Then).
- ‚úÖ Collaborate via the **Three Amigos**.
- ‚úÖ Create **Living Documentation**.
- ‚úÖ Use **Cucumber** or similar tools.

Align your code with your users using BDD! ü§ù
